newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Public Bank shares up on "foreign" talk.
newsitem.headline: Public Bank shares up on "foreign" talk.

text.p: Shares of Public Bank Bhd surged on speculation that the bank would soon allow foreign investors to buy the local tranche of the stock, dealers and analysts said.
But Public Bank's foreign shares plunged on the same speculation.
"People are selling the foreign and buying the local because there's a huge disparity of prices," said Audrey Ho, head of research at Mohaiyani Securities.
Around 0733 GMT, the local stock of Public Bank was up 22 cents to 3.54 ringgit.
The foreign tranche was down 38 cents to 4.04, hitting a 12-month low.
Company officials could not be immediately reached for comment. Market players said there was speculation that the bank has approved the plan.
